intro: Polycarpaea sumbana, commonly known as the Sumbanese polycarpaea, is a flowering plant native to the Indonesian island of Sumbawa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
